member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy
member.summary: Broad phase that incrementally updates the internal tree acceleration structure.
member.remarks: This is a good all-around broad phase; its performance is consistent and all queries are supported and speedy. The memory usage is higher than simple one-axis sort and sweep, but a bit lower than the Grid2DSortAndSweep option.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new dynamic hierarchy broad phase.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.#ctor(BEPUutilities.Threading.IParallelLooper)
member.summary: Constructs a new dynamic hierarchy broad phase.
member.param: Parallel loop provider to use in the broad phase.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.threadSplitOffsets
member.summary: This is a few test-based values which help threaded scaling. By going deeper into the trees, a better distribution of work is achieved. Going above the tested core count theoretically benefits from a '0 if power of 2, 2 otherwise' rule of thumb.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.Add(BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.BroadPhaseEntry)
member.summary: Adds an entry to the hierarchy.
member.param: Entry to add.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.Remove(BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.BroadPhaseEntry)
member.summary: Removes an entry from the hierarchy.
member.param: Entry to remove.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.ForceRebuild
member.summary: Forces a full rebuild of the tree. Useful to return the tree to a decent level of quality if the tree has gotten horribly messed up. Watch out, this is a slow operation. Expect to drop frames.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.Hierarchies.DynamicHierarchy.MeasureCostMetric
member.summary: Measures the cost of the tree, based on the volume of the tree's nodes. Approximates the expected cost of volume-based queries against the tree. Useful for comparing against other trees.
member.returns: Cost of the tree.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.SortAndSweep.Grid2DSortAndSweep
member.summary: Broad phase implementation that partitions objects into a 2d grid, and then performs a sort and sweep on the final axis.
member.remarks: This broad phase typically has very good collision performance and scales well with multithreading, but its query times can sometimes be worse than tree-based systems since it must scan cells. Keeping rays as short as possible helps avoid unnecessary cell checks. The performance can degrade noticeably in some situations involving significant off-axis motion.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.SortAndSweep.Grid2DSortAndSweep.CellSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of cells in the 2D grid. For sparser, larger scenes, increasing this can help performance. For denser scenes, decreasing this may help.

member.summary: Constructs a grid-based sort and sweep broad phase.
member.param: Parallel loop provider to use for the broad phase.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseSystems.SortAndSweep.SortAndSweep1D
member.summary: Simple and standard implementation of the one-axis sort and sweep (sweep and prune) algorithm.
member.remarks: In small scenarios, it can be the quickest option. It uses very little memory. However, it tends to scale poorly relative to other options and can slow down significantly when entries cluster along the axis. Additionally, it supports no queries at all.

member.summary: Fires when the entity stops touching another entity.

member.name: E:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.ContactEventManager`1.CollisionEnding
member.summary: Fires when the entity stops touching another entity. Unlike the CollisionEnded event, this event will run inline instead of at the end of the space's update. Some operations are unsupported while the engine is updating, and be especially careful if internal multithreading is enabled.

member.summary: Fires when a pair is updated and there are contact points in it.

member.summary: Fires when a pair is updated and there are contact points in it. Unlike the PairTouched event, this event will run inline instead of at the end of the space's update. Some operations are unsupported while the engine is updating, and be especially careful if internal multithreading is enabled.

Unlike the PairCreated event, this event will run inline instead of at the end of the space's update. Some operations are unsupported while the engine is updating, and be especially careful if internal multithreading is enabled.

member.name: E:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.EntryEventManager`1.RemovingPair
member.summary: Fires when this entity's bounding box no longer overlaps another entity's bounding box. Unlike the PairRemoved event, this event will run inline instead of at the end of the space's update. Some operations are unsupported while the engine is updating, and be especially careful if internal multithreading is enabled.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.EntryEventManager`1.VerifyEventStatus
member.summary: Removes the entity from the space's list of eventful entities if no events are active.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.EntryEventManager`1.RemoveAllEvents
member.summary: Removes all event hooks from the manager.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.PairCreatedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes overlap as determined by the broadphase system.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.CreatingPairEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes overlap as determined by the broadphase system. Unlike PairCreatedEventHandler, this will be called as soon as a pair is created instead of at the end of the frame. This allows the pair's data to be adjusted prior to any usage, but some actions are not supported due to the execution stage.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.PairRemovedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes cease to overlap as determined by the broadphase system.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
The entry formerly interacting with the sender via the deleted pair.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.RemovingPairEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two objects' bounding boxes cease to overlap as determined by the broadphase system. Unlike PairRemovedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of pair removal instead of at the end of the space's update.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
The entry formerly interacting with the sender via the deleted pair.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.ContactCreatedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies are touching and generate a contact point.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.
Created contact data.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.CreatingContactEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies are touching and generate a contact point. Unlike ContactCreatedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact generation instead of at the end of the space's update. This allows the contact's data to be adjusted prior to usage in the velocity solver, but other actions such as altering the owning space's pair or entry listings are unsafe.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.
Newly generated contact point between the pair's two bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; contacts can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.InitialCollisionDetectedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies initally collide and generate a contact point.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.DetectingInitialCollisionEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies initally collide and generate a contact point. Unlike InitialCollisionDetectedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact creation instead of at the end of the space's update. Performing operations outside of the scope of the pair is unsafe.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.ContactRemovedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when a contact point between two bodies is removed.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies and data about the removed contact. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.
Removed contact data.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.RemovingContactEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when a contact point between two bodies is removed. Unlike ContactRemovedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact removal instead of at the end of the space's update. Performing operations outside of the scope of the controller is unsafe.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.

Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies and data about the removed contact. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.
Contact between the two entries. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; it will be immediately returned to the resource pool after the event handler completes.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.CollisionEndedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies go from a touching state to a separated state.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair overseeing the collision. Note that this instance may be invalid if the entries' bounding boxes no longer overlap.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.CollisionEndingEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic when two bodies go from a touching state to a separated state. Unlike CollisionEndedEventHandler, this will trigger at the time of contact removal instead of at the end of the space's update. Performing operations outside of the scope of the controller is unsafe.
member.param: Entry sending the event.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair presiding over the interaction of the two involved bodies. This reference cannot be safely kept outside of the scope of the handler; pairs can quickly return to the resource pool.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.PairUpdatedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair that was updated.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.PairUpdatingEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules. Unlike PairUpdatedEventHandler, this is called at the time of the collision detection update rather than at the end of the space's update. Other entries' information may not be up to date, and operations acting on data outside of the character controller may be unsafe.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair that was updated.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.PairTouchedEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method if the two objects are colliding. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair that was updated.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.Events.PairTouchingEventHandler`1
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform at the end of a pair's UpdateContactManifold method if the two objects are colliding. This is called every single update regardless if the process was quit early or did not complete due to interaction rules. Unlike PairTouchedEventHandler, this is called at the time of the collision detection update rather than at the end of the space's update. Other entries' information may not be up to date, and operations acting on data outside of the character controller may be unsafe.
member.param: Entry involved in the pair monitored for events.
Other entry within the pair opposing the monitored entry.
Pair that was updated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.MobileMeshCollidable.ImproveBoundaryBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the collision system should attempt to improve contact behavior at the boundaries between triangles. This has a slight performance cost, but prevents objects sliding across a triangle boundary from 'bumping,' and otherwise improves the robustness of contacts at edges and vertices.

member.summary: Gets the shape of the collidable.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.Entity
member.summary: Gets the entity owning the collidable.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.WorldTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets the world transform of the collidable. The EntityCollidable's LocalPosition is ignored for this process; the shape will end up centered exactly on the world transform. Setting this property also updates the bounding box.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.IsActive
member.summary: Gets whether this collidable is associated with an active entity. True if it is, false if it's not.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.LocalPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the local position of the collidable. The local position can be used to offset the collision geometry from an entity's center of mass.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.UpdateBoundingBox
member.summary: Updates the bounding box of the mobile collidable according to the associated entity's current state. Do not use this if the EntityCollidable does not have an associated entity; consider using UpdateBoundingBoxForTransform instead.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.UpdateBoundingBox(System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the bounding box of the mobile collidable according to the associated entity's current state. Do not use this if the EntityCollidable does not have an associated entity; consider using UpdateBoundingBoxForTransform instead.
member.param: Timestep with which to update the bounding box.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.UpdateWorldTransform(BEPUutilities.Vector3@,BEPUutilities.Quaternion@)
member.summary: Updates the world transform of the shape using the given position and orientation. The world transform of the shape is offset from the given position and orientation by the collidable's LocalPosition.
member.param: Position to use for the calculation.
Orientation to use for the calculation.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.UpdateBoundingBoxForTransform(BEPUutilities.RigidTransform@,System.Double)
member.summary: Updates the collidable's world transform and bounding box. The transform provided will be offset by the collidable's LocalPosition to get the shape transform. This is a convenience method for external modification of the collidable's data.
member.param: Transform to use for the collidable.
Duration of the simulation time step. Used to expand the bounding box using the owning entity's velocity. If the collidable does not have an owning entity, this must be zero.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.UpdateBoundingBoxForTransform(BEPUutilities.RigidTransform@)
member.summary: Updates the collidable's world transform and bounding box. This is a convenience method for external modification of the collidable's data.
member.param: Transform to use for the collidable.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.Events
member.summary: Gets or sets the event manager of the collidable.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable.OverlappedEntities
member.summary: Gets an enumerable collection of all entities overlapping this collidable.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh
member.summary: Collidable mesh which can be created from a reusable InstancedMeshShape. Very little data is needed for each individual InstancedMesh object, allowing a complicated mesh to be repeated many times. Since the hierarchy used to accelerate collisions is purely local, it may be marginally slower than an individual StaticMesh.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh.WorldTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets the world transform of the mesh.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh.UpdateBoundingBox
member.summary: Updates the bounding box to the current state of the entry.

member.summary: Constructs a new InstancedMesh.
member.param: Shape to use for the instance.

member.summary: Constructs a new InstancedMesh.
member.param: Shape to use for the instance.
Transform to use for the instance.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh.Shape
member.summary: Gets the shape used by the instanced mesh.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh.Sidedness
member.summary: Gets or sets the sidedness of the mesh. This can be used to ignore collisions and rays coming from a direction relative to the winding of the triangle.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh.ImproveBoundaryBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the collision system should attempt to improve contact behavior at the boundaries between triangles. This has a slight performance cost, but prevents objects sliding across a triangle boundary from 'bumping,' and otherwise improves the robustness of contacts at edges and vertices.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh.Events
member.summary: Gets the event manager of the mesh.

member.summary: Tests a ray against the entry.
member.param: Ray to test.
Maximum length, in units of the ray's direction's length, to test.
Hit location of the ray on the entry, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the ray hit the entry.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.InstancedMesh.RayCast(BEPUutilities.Ray,System.Double,BEPUutilities.TriangleSidedness,BEPUutilities.RayHit@)
member.summary: Tests a ray against the instance.
member.param: Ray to test.
Maximum length of the ray to test; in units of the ray's direction's length.
Sidedness to use during the ray cast. This does not have to be the same as the mesh's sidedness.
The hit location of the ray on the mesh, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the ray hit the mesh.

member.summary: Casts a convex shape against the collidable.
member.param: Shape to cast.
Initial transform of the shape.
Sweep to apply to the shape.
Hit data, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the cast hit anything.

member.summary: Updates the detector volume's interpretation of the mesh. This should be called when the the TriangleMesh is changed significantly. This is called automatically if the TriangleMesh property is set.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.DetectorVolume.locker
member.summary: Used to protect against containment changes coming in from multithreaded narrowphase contexts.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.EntityBeginsTouchingVolumeEventHandler
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform when an entry begins touching a detector volume. Runs within an update loop for updateables; modifying the updateable listing during the event is disallowed.
member.param: DetectorVolume being touched.
Entry touching the volume.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.EntityStopsTouchingVolumeEventHandler
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform when an entry stops touching a detector volume. Runs within an update loop for updateables; modifying the updateable listing during the event is disallowed.
member.param: DetectorVolume no longer being touched.
Entry no longer touching the volume.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.VolumeBeginsContainingEntityEventHandler
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform when an entity begins being contained by a detector volume. Runs within an update loop for updateables; modifying the updateable listing during the event is disallowed.
member.param: DetectorVolume containing the entry.
Entity contained by the volume.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.VolumeStopsContainingEntityEventHandler
member.summary: Handles any special logic to perform when an entry stops being contained by a detector volume. Runs within an update loop for updateables; modifying the updateable listing during the event is disallowed.
member.param: DetectorVolume no longer containing the entry.
Entity no longer contained by the volume.

member.summary: Gets the contact categorizer used by the character to determine how contacts affect the character's movement.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.StepManager
member.summary: Gets the manager responsible for finding places for the character to step up and down to.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.StanceManager
member.summary: Gets the manager responsible for crouching, standing, and the verification involved in changing states.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.QueryManager
member.summary: Gets the support system which other systems use to perform local ray casts and contact queries.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.HorizontalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraint used by the character to handle horizontal motion. This includes acceleration due to player input and deceleration when the relative velocity between the support and the character exceeds specified maximums.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.VerticalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraint used by the character to stay glued to surfaces it stands on.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.PairLocker
member.summary: Gets or sets the pair locker used by the character controller to avoid interfering with the behavior of other characters.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.Down
member.summary: Gets or sets the down direction of the character, defining its orientation.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.ViewDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the view direction associated with the character. Also sets the horizontal view direction internally based on the current down vector. This is used to interpret the movement directions.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.JumpSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character leaves the ground when it jumps.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.SlidingJumpSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character leaves the ground when it jumps without traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.JumpForceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of force to apply to supporting dynamic entities as a fraction of the force used to reach the jump speed.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.StandingSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move while standing with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.CrouchingSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move while crouching with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.ProneSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move while prone with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.TractionForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which provides traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.SlidingSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move while on a support that does not provide traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.SlidingForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which does not provide traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.AirSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move with no support. The character will not be decelerated while airborne.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.AirForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply with no support.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.SpeedScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a scaling factor to apply to the maximum speed of the character. This is useful when a character does not have 0 or MaximumSpeed target speed, but rather intermediate values. A common use case is analog controller sticks.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.BodyRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the body cylinder. To change the height, use the StanceManager.StandingHeight and StanceManager.CrouchingHeight.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.CollisionMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the collision margin of the body cylinder. Also updates the StanceManager's query shapes to match.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.SupportFinder
member.summary: Gets the support finder used by the character. The support finder analyzes the character's contacts to see if any of them provide support and/or traction.
Constructs a new character controller.
member.param: Initial position of the character.
Height of the character body while standing.
Height of the character body while crouching.
Height of the character body while prone.
Radius of the character body.

Radius of 'rounding' applied to the cylindrical body. Higher values make the cylinder's edges more rounded. The margin is contained within the cylinder's height and radius, so it must not exceed the radius or height of the cylinder. To change the collision margin later, use the CharacterController.CollisionMargin property.
Mass of the character body.
Steepest slope, in radians, that the character can maintain traction on.
Steepest slope, in radians, that the character can consider a support.
Speed at which the character will try to move while crouching with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.
Speed at which the character will try to move while crouching with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.
Speed at which the character will try to move while prone with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.
Maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which provides traction.
Speed at which the character will try to move while on a support that does not provide traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.
Maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which does not provide traction
Speed at which the character will try to move with no support. The character will not be decelerated while airborne.
Maximum force that the character can apply with no support.
Speed at which the character leaves the ground when it jumps
Speed at which the character leaves the ground when it jumps without traction
Maximum force the vertical motion constraint is allowed to apply in an attempt to keep the character on the ground.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.ExpandBoundingBox
member.summary: Cylinder shape used to compute the expanded bounding box of the character.

member.summary: Changes the relative velocity between the character and its support.

Change to apply to the character and support relative velocity.
Relative velocity to update.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterController.Jump
member.summary: Jumps the character off of whatever it's currently standing on. If it has traction, it will go straight up. If it doesn't have traction, but is still supported by something, it will jump in the direction of the surface normal.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer
member.summary: Used by characters to figure out how to interpret a character's collisions for the purposes of movement.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer.TractionThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the value compared against the result of dot(outward facing contact normal, character down direction) to determine if a character has traction because of a contact. A value near 1 implies that the character will have traction only when the support normal is almost aligned with the character's vertical axis. A value near epsilon implies that the character can walk up extremely steep slopes with traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer.SupportThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the value compared against the result of dot(outward facing contact normal, character down direction) to determine if a character has support because of a contact. A value near 1 implies that the character will have support only when the support normal is almost aligned with the character's vertical axis. A value near epsilon implies that the character will consider very steep surfaces as supports. Should be less than or equal to the TractionThreshold.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer.HeadThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the value compared against the result of dot(outward facing contact normal, character down direction) to determine if a contact is on top of the character. A value near -1 implies that the contact will only be considered a 'head' contact when the support normal is almost aligned with the character's vertical axis. A value near -epsilon implies that almost all upper contacts will be considered head contacts.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer.MaximumTractionSlope
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum slope that a character can have traction on.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer.MaximumSupportSlope
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum slope that a character can be supported by.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new character contact categorizer.
member.param: Maximum slope that a character can have traction on.
Maximum slope that a character can be supported by.

Value compared against the result of dot(outward facing contact normal, character down direction) to determine if a contact is on top of the character. A value near -1 implies that the contact will only be considered a 'head' contact when the support normal is almost aligned with the character's vertical axis. A value near -epsilon implies that almost all upper contacts will be considered head contacts.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterContactCategorizer.CategorizeContacts``1(BEPUphysics.NarrowPhaseSystems.Pairs.CollidablePairHandler,BEPUphysics.BroadPhaseEntries.MobileCollidables.EntityCollidable,BEPUutilities.Vector3@,``0@,``0@,``0@,``0@)
member.summary: Takes a collision pair and distributes its contacts into categories according to the categorizer's thresholds.
member.param: Source of the contacts to categorize.
Collidable associated with the character.
Down direction of the character.
List to contain the traction contacts found in the input contacts list.
List to contain the support contacts found in the input contacts list.
List to contain the side contacts found in the input contacts list.
List to contain the head contacts found in the input contacts list.
member.typeparam: List type used to store the output character contact structs.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterPairLocker.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity)
member.summary: Constructs a new character pair locker.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterPairLocker.LockCharacterPairs
member.summary: Locks all pairs which involve other characters.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.CharacterPairLocker.UnlockCharacterPairs

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Manages the horizontal movement of a character.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MovementDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the goal movement direction. The movement direction is based on the view direction. Values of X are applied to the axis perpendicular to the HorizontalViewDirection and Down direction. Values of Y are applied to the HorizontalViewDirection.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.TargetSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the target speed of the character in its current state.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force the character can apply to move horizontally in its current state.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MaximumAccelerationForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force the character can apply to accelerate. This will not let the character apply more force than the MaximumForce; the actual applied force is constrained by both this and the MaximumForce property.

summary.para: Gets or sets the time it takes for the character to achieve stable footing after trying to stop moving. When a character has stable footing, it will resist position drift relative to its support. For example, if the player was on a rotating platform, integrating the velocity repeatedly would otherwise make the character gradually shift relative to the support.

This time should be longer than the time it takes the player to decelerate from normal movement while it has traction. Otherwise, the character will seem to 'rubber band' back to a previous location after the character tries to stop.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.PositionAnchorDistanceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance beyond which the character will reset its goal position. When a character is standing still (as defined by TimeUntilStableFooting), a shove smaller than this threshold will result in an attempt to return to the previous anchor. A shove which pushes the character more than this threshold will cause a new anchor to be created.

summary.para: Gets whether the character currently has stable footing. If true, the character will resist position drift relative to its support. For example, if the character was on a rotating platform while trying to stand still relative to the platform, integrating the velocity repeatedly would make the character gradually shift relative to the platform. The anchoring effect of stable footing keeps the character near the same relative location.
Can only occur when the character has traction and is not trying to move while standing on an entity.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.ResetPositionAnchor
member.summary: Forces a recomputation of the position anchor during the next update if a position anchor is currently active. The new position anchor will be dropped at the character's location as of the next update.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MovementMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the current movement style used by the character.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.MovementDirection3d
member.summary: Gets the 3d movement direction, as updated in the previous call to UpdateMovementBasis. Note that this will not change when MovementDirection is set. It only changes on a call to UpdateMovementBasis. So, getting this value externally will get the previous frame's snapshot.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.StrafeDirection
member.summary: Gets the strafe direction as updated in the previous call to UpdateMovementBasis.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.ForwardDirection
member.summary: Gets the horizontal forward direction as updated in the previous call to UpdateMovementBasis.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.UpdateMovementBasis(BEPUutilities.Vector3@)
member.summary: Updates the movement basis of the horizontal motion constraint. Should be updated automatically by the character on each time step; other code should not need to call this.
member.param: Forward facing direction of the character.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.UpdateSupportData
member.summary: Updates the constraint's view of the character's support data.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SupportForceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor of forces applied to the supporting object if it is a dynamic entity. Low values (below 1) reduce the amount of motion imparted to the support object; it acts 'heavier' as far as horizontal motion is concerned. High values (above 1) increase the force applied to support objects, making them appear lighter. Be careful when changing this- it can create impossible situations!

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Character.SupportFinder)
member.summary: Constructs a new horizontal motion constraint.
member.param: Character body to be governed by this constraint.
Helper used to find supports for the character.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.Update(System.Double)
member.summary: Computes per-frame information necessary for the constraint.
member.param: Time step duration.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.ExclusiveUpdate
member.summary: Performs any per-frame initialization needed by the constraint that must be done with exclusive access to the connected objects.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SolveIteration
member.summary: Computes a solution to the constraint.
member.returns: Impulse magnitude computed by the iteration.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.RelativeVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current velocity between the character and its support in constraint space. The X component corresponds to velocity along the movement direction. The Y component corresponds to velocity perpendicular to the movement direction and support normal.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.RelativeWorldVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current velocity between the character and its support.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.SupportVelocity
member.summary: Gets the velocity of the support at the support point.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.CharacterAccumulatedImpulse
member.summary: Gets the accumulated impulse in world space applied to the character.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.HorizontalMotionConstraint.AccumulatedImpulse
member.summary: Gets the accumulated impulse in constraint space. The X component corresponds to impulse along the movement direction. The Y component corresponds to impulse perpendicular to the movement direction and support normal.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Character.StanceManager

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Character.StanceManager.characterBody

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.StanceManager.StandingHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the character while standing. To avoid resizing-related problems, use this only when the character is not being actively simulated or is not currently standing.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.StanceManager.CrouchingHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the character while crouching. Must be less than the standing height. To avoid resizing-related problems, use this only when the character is not being actively simulated or is not currently crouching.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.StanceManager.ProneHeight

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.StepManager.MinimumDownStepHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum down step height. Down steps which are smaller than this are simply ignored by the step system; instead, the character falls. If the new step location has traction, the intermediate falling will not remove traction from the character. The only difference is that the character isn't teleported down when the step is too small.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum distance from the character's center to the support that will be assisted by downstepping. If the character walks off a step with height less than this value, the character will retain traction despite being temporarily airborne according to its contacts.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SupportFinder.BottomDistance
member.summary: Gets the vertical distance from the center of the character to the bottom of the character.

member.summary: Computes a combined support contact from all available supports (contacts or ray).

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SupportFinder.VerticalSupportData
member.summary: Gets the support data of the character biased towards the character's movement direction. Excludes contacts that might otherwise cause the vertical motion constraint to fight the character's movement.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.SupportFinder.UpdateVerticalSupportData(BEPUutilities.Vector3@,BEPUutilities.Vector3@)
member.summary: Computes a traction contact using a movement direction. This is helpful for the vertical motion constraint. By biasing the search in the movement direction, contacts on the character's butt (which might otherwise hold the character back via the vertical motion constraint) are ignored.
member.param: Down direction of the character.
Movement direction of the character.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Character.VerticalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Keeps a character glued to the ground, if possible.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.VerticalMotionConstraint.MaximumGlueForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the constraint will apply in attempting to keep the character stuck to the ground.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.VerticalMotionConstraint.SupportForceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the scaling factor of forces applied to the supporting object if it is a dynamic entity. Low values (below 1) reduce the amount of motion imparted to the support object; it acts 'heavier' as far as vertical motion is concerned. High values (above 1) increase the force applied to support objects, making them appear lighter.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.VerticalMotionConstraint.EffectiveMass
member.summary: Gets the effective mass felt by the constraint.

member.summary: Constructs a new vertical motion constraint.

Support finder used by the character.
Maximum force the vertical motion constraint is allowed to apply in an attempt to keep the character on the ground.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.VerticalMotionConstraint.UpdateSupportData
member.summary: Updates the movement basis of the horizontal motion constraint and updates the horizontal motion constraint's support data. Should be updated automatically by the character on each time step; other code should not need to call this.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Character.VerticalMotionConstraint.UpdateSolverActivity
member.summary: Updates the activity state of the constraint. Called automatically by the solver.

member.summary: Computes a solution to the constraint.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController
member.summary: Gives a physical object simple and cheap FPS-like control. This character has less features than the full CharacterController but is a little bit faster.

member.summary: Gets the physical body of the character.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.ContactCategorizer
member.summary: Gets the contact categorizer used by the character to determine how contacts affect the character's movement.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.QueryManager
member.summary: Gets the support system which other systems use to perform local ray casts and contact queries.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.HorizontalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraint used by the character to handle horizontal motion. This includes acceleration due to player input and deceleration when the relative velocity between the support and the character exceeds specified maximums.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.VerticalMotionConstraint
member.summary: Gets the constraint used by the character to stay glued to surfaces it stands on.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.PairLocker
member.summary: Gets or sets the pair locker used by the character controller to avoid interfering with the behavior of other characters.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.Down
member.summary: Gets or sets the down direction of the character. Controls the interpretation of movement and support finding.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.ViewDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the view direction associated with the character. Also sets the horizontal view direction internally based on the current down vector. This is used to interpret the movement directions.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.JumpSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character leaves the ground when it jumps.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.SlidingJumpSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character leaves the ground when it jumps without traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.JumpForceFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of force to apply to supporting dynamic entities as a fraction of the force used to reach the jump speed.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.Speed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move while standing with a support that provides traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.TractionForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which provides traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.SlidingSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move while on a support that does not provide traction. Relative velocities with a greater magnitude will be decelerated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.SlidingForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply while on a support which does not provide traction.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.AirSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which the character will try to move with no support. The character will not be decelerated while airborne.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.AirForce
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum force that the character can apply with no support.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.SpeedScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a scaling factor to apply to the maximum speed of the character. This is useful when a character does not have 0 or MaximumSpeed target speed, but rather intermediate values. A common use case is analog controller sticks.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Character.SphereCharacterController.SupportFinder
member.summary: Gets the support finder used by the character. The support finder analyzes the character's contacts to see if any of them provide support and/or traction.

member.summary: Jumps the character off of whatever it's currently standing on. If it has traction, it will go straight up. If it doesn't have traction, but is still supported by something, it will jump in the direction of the surface normal.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule
member.summary: Defines a set of rules that collisions can adhere to.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.Defer
member.summary: Yields the interaction type's determination to a later stage.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.Normal
member.summary: Uses all of collision detection, including creating a collision pair, creating contacts when appropriate, and responding to those contacts physically. If a collision pair is forced to use a 'normal' interaction but both entities in the pair are kinematic, the collision response will be skipped.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoSolver
member.summary: Creates a collision pair and undergoes narrow phase testing, but does not collision response in the solver.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoNarrowPhaseUpdate
member.summary: Creates a broad phase overlap and narrow phase pair but the collision is never updated. It cannot generate contacts nor undergo solving.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoNarrowPhasePair
member.summary: Creates a broad phase overlap but does not create any narrow phase pairs. It cannot generate contacts nor undergo solving.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRule.NoBroadPhase
member.summary: Does not create a broad phase overlap. No further collision detection or response takes place.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules
member.summary: Stores how an object can interact with other objects through collisions.

member.name: E:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.CollisionRulesChanged
member.summary: Fires when the contained collision rules are altered.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new CollisionRules instance.

member.summary: Serves as a hash function for a particular type.
member.returns: A hash code for the current .

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.Group
member.summary: The collision group to which the object owning this instance belongs to. This is overridden by any relationships defined in the Specific collection with CollisionRules other than CollisionRule.Defer. This is also overriden by the Personal CollisionRule if it is anything but CollisionRule.Defer. If the interaction type between the group is defined as CollisionRule.Defer, it is considered to be CollisionRule.normal as the collision group is the final stage.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.Personal
member.summary: Determines in general how the object owning this instance should react to other objects. This is overridden by any relationships defined in the Specific collection with CollisionRules other than CollisionRule.Defer. If this is not set to CollisionRule.Defer, it will override the collision group's collision rules.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.Specific
member.summary: Specifies how the object owning this instance should react to other individual objects. Any rules defined in this collection will take priority over the Personal collision rule and the collision group's collision rules. Objects that are not in this collection are considered to have a relationship of CollisionRule.Defer.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.CollisionGroupRules
member.summary: Defines any special collision rules between collision groups.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.DefaultCollisionRule
member.summary: If a CollisionRule calculation between two colliding objects results in no defined CollisionRule, this value will be used.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.DefaultDynamicCollisionGroup
member.summary: When a dynamic entity is created and added to a space without having a specific collision group set beforehand, it inherits this collision group. There are no special rules associated with this group by default; entities within this group have normal, full interaction with all other entities. Collision group interaction rules can be overriden by entity personal collision rules or entity-to-entity specific collision rules.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionRuleManagement.CollisionRules.DefaultKinematicCollisionGroup
member.summary:
When a kinematic entity is created and added to a space without having a specific collision group set beforehand, it inherits this collision group. Entities in this collision group will not create collision pairs with other entities of this collision group by default. All other interactions are normal. Collision group interaction rules can be overriden by entity personal collision rules or entity-to-entity specific collision rules.
Non-entity collidable objects like static triangle meshes also use this collision group by default.

member.param: First ruleset owner in the pair. This entity's space is used to determine the collision detection settings that contain special collision group interaction rules.

member.returns: Collision rule governing the interaction between the pair.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.ConvexShape
member.summary: Superclass of convex collision shapes.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.ConvexShape.CollisionMargin
member.summary: Collision margin of the convex shape. The margin is a small spherical expansion around entities which allows specialized collision detection algorithms to be used. It's recommended that this be left unchanged.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.ConvexShape.MinimumRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum radius of the collidable's shape. This is initialized to a value that is guaranteed to be equal to or smaller than the actual minimum radius. When setting this property, ensure that the inner sphere formed by the new minimum radius is fully contained within the shape.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.ConvexShape.MaximumRadius
member.summary: Gets the maximum radius of the collidable's shape. This is initialized to a value that is guaranteed to be equal to or larger than the actual maximum radius.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper
member.summary: Helper class used to compute volume distribution information, which is in turn used to compute inertia tensor information.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper.InertiaTensorScale
member.summary: Value to scale any created entities' inertia tensors by. Larger tensors (above 1) improve stiffness of constraints and contacts, while smaller values (towards 1) are closer to 'realistic' behavior. Defaults to 2.5.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper.NumberOfSamplesPerDimension
member.summary: Number of samples the system takes along a side of an object's AABB when voxelizing it.

member.param: Weight of the point.
Location to use as the center for the purposes of computing the contribution.
Point to compute the contribution of.
Contribution of the point.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper.SampleDirections
member.summary: Set of directions sampled by the inertia helper when constructing a mesh representation of a convex object.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.InertiaHelper.SampleTriangleIndices
member.summary: Set of triangles represented by groups of three indices into the SampleDirections array.

member.summary: Generates a sphere by progressively refining a tetrahedral mesh.

Vertex buffer of the sphere.
Index buffer of the sphere. Each group of three integers represents one triangle.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.MinkowskiSumShape
member.summary: A shape composed of the pointwise summation of all points in child shapes. For example, the minkowski sum of two spheres would be a sphere with the radius of both spheres combined. The minkowski sum of a box and a sphere would be a rounded box.

member.summary: Gets the list of shapes in the minkowski sum.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.MinkowskiSumShape.LocalOffset
member.summary: Gets the local offset of the elements in the minkowski sum. This is required because convex shapes need to be centered on their local origin.

member.summary: Constructs a minkowski sum shape. A minkowski sum can be created from more than two objects; use the other constructors. The sum will be recentered on its local origin. The computed center is outputted by the other constructor.

Second entry in the sum.

member.summary: Gets or sets the margin of the mobile mesh to use when colliding with other meshes. When colliding with non-mesh shapes, the mobile mesh has no margin.

member.summary: Gets the solidity of the mesh.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.Sidedness
member.summary: Gets or sets the sidedness of the shape. This is a convenience property based on the Solidity property. If the shape is solid, this returns whatever sidedness is computed to make the triangles of the shape face outward. If the shape is solid, setting this property will change the sidedness that is used while the shape is solid.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.SidednessWhenSolid
member.summary: Gets the triangle sidedness required if the mesh is in solid mode. If the windings were reversed or double sided, the solidity would fight against shell contacts, leading to very bad jittering.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.IsLocalRayOriginInMesh(BEPUutilities.Ray@,BEPUutilities.RayHit@)
member.summary: Tests to see if a ray's origin is contained within the mesh. If it is, the hit location is found. If it isn't, the hit location is still valid if a hit occurred. If the origin isn't inside and there was no hit, the hit has a T value of double.MaxValue.
member.param: Ray in the local space of the shape to test.
The first hit against the mesh, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the ray origin was in the mesh.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshShape.MeshHitUniquenessThreshold
member.summary: The difference in t parameters in a ray cast under which two hits are considered to be redundant.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity
member.summary: Solidity of a triangle or mesh. A triangle can be double sided, or allow one of its sides to let interacting objects through. The entire mesh can be made solid, which means objects on the interior still generate contacts even if there aren't any triangles to hit. Solidity requires the mesh to be closed.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.DoubleSided
member.summary: The mesh will interact with objects coming from both directions.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.Clockwise
member.summary: The mesh will interact with objects from which the winding of the triangles appears to be clockwise.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.Counterclockwise
member.summary: The mesh will interact with objects from which the winding of the triangles appears to be counterclockwise.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.MobileMeshSolidity.Solid
member.summary: The mesh will treat objects inside of its concave shell as if the mesh had volume. Mesh must be closed for this to work properly.

member.summary: Gets overlapped triangles with the terrain shape with a bounding box in the local space of the shape.
member.param: Bounding box in the local space of the terrain shape.

Indices of triangles whose bounding boxes overlap the input bounding box. Encoded as 2 * (quadRowIndex * terrainWidthInQuads + quadColumnIndex) + isFirstTriangleOfQuad ? 0 : 1, where isFirstTriangleOfQuad refers to which of the two triangles in a quad is being requested. Matches the input of the TerrainShape.GetTriangle function.
member.typeparam: Type of the list to fill with overlaps.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox
member.summary: Contains a variety of queries and computation methods that make use of minkowski portal refinement.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.InnerIterationLimit
member.summary: Number of iterations that the MPR system will run in its inner loop before giving up and returning with failure.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.OuterIterationLimit
member.summary: Number of iterations that the MPR system will run in its outer loop before giving up and moving on to its inner loop.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.SurfaceEpsilon
member.summary: Gets or sets how close surface-finding based MPR methods have to get before exiting. Defaults to 1e-7.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.DepthRefinementEpsilon
member.summary: Gets or sets how close the penetration depth refinement system should converge before quitting. Making this smaller can help more precisely find a local minimum at the cost of performance. The change will likely only be visible on curved shapes, since polytopes will converge extremely rapidly to a precise local minimum. Defaults to 1e-4.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.RayCastSurfaceEpsilon
member.summary: Gets or sets how close surface-finding ray casts have to get before exiting. Defaults to 1e-9.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.MPRToolbox.MaximumDepthRefinementIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of iterations to use to reach the local penetration depth minimum when using the RefinePenetration function. Increasing this allows the system to work longer to find local penetration minima. The change will likely only be visible on curved shapes, since polytopes will converge extremely rapidly to a precise local minimum. Defaults to 3.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.CollisionTests.CollisionAlgorithms.TriangleConvexPairTester.EscapeAttemptPeriod
member.summary: The number of updates between attempts to reset to the cheaper Plane collision state instead of more expensive GJK-based tests. This is used by the ExternalSeparated state because it only generates a boolean result. ExternalNear, which DOES generate contact information, also uses it to reduce the frequency of voronoi region tests. Deep just transitions to ExternalNear when penetration is slight rather than trying to jump to Plane.

member.summary: Gets the solver to which the solver updateable belongs.

member.summary: Gets the simulation island connection associated with this updateable.

member.summary: List of all entities affected by this updateable.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.InvolvedEntities
member.summary: Gets the entities that this solver updateable is involved with.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.numberOfInvolvedEntities
member.summary: Number of entities used in the solver updateable. Note that this is set automatically by the sortInvolvedEntities method if it is called.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.SolverSettings
member.summary: Gets the solver settings that manage how the solver updates.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.IsActive
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether or not this solver updateable is active.
When set to false, this solver updateable will be idle and its isActiveInSolver field will always be false.
When set to true, the solver updateable will run normally and update if the type's activity conditions allow it.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.IsActiveInSolver
member.summary: Gets whether or not the space's solver should try to solve this object. Depends on conditions specific to each solver updateable type and whether or not it has completed its computations early. Recomputed each frame.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.ActivateInvolvedEntities
member.summary: Activates all entities involved with this solver updateable.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.SolverGroup
member.summary: Gets the solver group that manages this solver updateable, if any. Null if not owned by a solver group.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.EnterLock
member.summary: Acquires exclusive access to all entities involved in the solver updateable.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.ExitLock
member.summary: Releases exclusive access to the updateable's entities. This should be called within a 'finally' block following a 'try' block containing the locked operations.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.TryEnterLock
member.summary: Attempts to acquire exclusive access to all entities involved in the solver updateable. If it is contested, the lock attempt is aborted.
member.returns: True if the lock was entered successfully, false otherwise.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverUpdateable.UpdateSolverActivity
member.summary: Updates the activity state of the solver updateable based on its members.

member.summary: Performs the frame's configuration step.
member.param: Timestep duration.

member.summary: Performs any pre-solve iteration work that needs exclusive access to the members of the solver updateable. Usually, this is used for applying warmstarting impulses.

member.summary: Computes one iteration of the constraint to meet the solver updateable's goal.
member.returns: The rough applied impulse magnitude.

member.summary: Handle any bookkeeping needed when the entities involved in this SolverUpdateable change.

member.summary: Collects the entities involved in a solver updateable and sets up the internal listings.

member.summary: Sorts the involved entities according to their hashcode to allow non-batched multithreading to avoid deadlocks.

member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum impulse that the constraint will attempt to apply when satisfying its requirements. This field can be used to simulate friction in a constraint.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angular speed that this constraint allows.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SingleEntity.MaximumAngularSpeedConstraint.Softness
member.summary: Gets and sets the softness of this constraint. Higher values of softness allow the constraint to be violated more. Must be greater than zero. Sometimes, if a joint system is unstable, increasing the softness of the involved constraints will make it settle down. For motors, softness can be used to implement damping. For a damping constant k, the appropriate softness is 1/k.

member.summary: Gets the total impulse applied by the constraint.

member.summary: Calculates and applies corrective impulses. Called automatically by space.

member.summary: Calculates necessary information for velocity solving. Called automatically by space.
member.param: Time in seconds since the last update.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverGroups.CustomizableSolverGroup
member.summary:
Constraint made from other constraints. Putting constraints into a solver group can help with organization and, in some cases, performance.
If you have multiple constraints between the same two entities, putting the constraints into a CustomizableSolverGroup can lower lock contention.
Be careful about overloading a single solvergroup; it should be kept relatively small to ensure that the multithreading loads stay balanced.

member.summary: Adds a new solver updateable to the solver group.
member.param: Solver updateable to add.

member.summary: Removes a solver updateable from the solver group.
member.param: Solver updateable to remove.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings
member.summary: Contains information about how a wheel solves its constraints.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.currentIterations
member.summary: Used to count how many iterations have taken place so far.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MaximumIterationCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum iterations that the wheel constraint can undergo. If the space's iteration count is lower than this, the solver will only attempt as many iterations as the space iteration count. Lower iteration counts are less accurate, but can improve performance.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MinimumIterationCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of iterations that will be applied. If an impulse of magnitude smaller than the MinimumImpulse is applied, a 'tiny impulses' counter increases. Once it exceeds the MinimumIterations, the system can decide to stop solving to save time if appropriate.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.MinimumImpulse
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower limit for impulses. Impulses applied with magnitudes less than this will increment the 'tiny impulse' counter, which is checked against the MinimumIterations property. If there's been too many tiny impulses in a row, then the system will stop trying to solve to save time. Higher values will allow the system to give up earlier, but can harm accuracy.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.DefaultMinimumImpulse
member.summary: The value to assign to new constraints' SolverSettings.MinimumImpulse. Impulses with magnitudes below this value will count as effectively zero in determining iteration early outs unless changed in the constraint's solver settings. High values quicken the short circuit but can cause instability, while low values will often prevent short circuiting, possibly increasing accuracy but harming performance. Defaults to .001f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SolverSettings.DefaultMinimumIterationCount
member.summary: The value to assign to new constraints' SolverSettings.MinimumIterations. Constraints are able to skip extra calculations if deemed appropriate after they complete the minimum iterations. Higher values force the system to wait longer before trying to early out, possibly improving behavior. Defaults to 1.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringAdvancedSettings
member.summary: Contains the error reduction factor and softness of a constraint. These can be used to make the same behaviors as the stiffness and damping constants, but may provide a more intuitive representation for rigid constraints.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringAdvancedSettings.ErrorReductionFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the error reduction parameter of the spring.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringAdvancedSettings.Softness
member.summary: Gets or sets the softness of the joint. Higher values allow the constraint to be violated more.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringAdvancedSettings.UseAdvancedSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to use the advanced settings. If this is set to true, the errorReductionFactor and softness will be used instead of the stiffness constant and damping constant.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringSettings
member.summary: Specifies the way in which a constraint's spring component behaves.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringSettings.Advanced
member.summary: Gets an object containing the solver's direct view of the spring behavior.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringSettings.Damping
member.summary: Gets or sets the damping coefficient of this spring. Higher values reduce oscillation more.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringSettings.Stiffness
member.summary: Gets or sets the stiffness coefficient of this spring. Higher values make the spring stiffer.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.SpringSettings.ComputeErrorReductionAndSoftness(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Computes the error reduction parameter and softness of a constraint based on its constants. Automatically called by constraint presteps to compute their per-frame values.
member.param: Simulation timestep.
Inverse simulation timestep.
Error reduction factor to use this frame.
Adjusted softness of the constraint for this frame.

member.summary: Constrains the relative orientation of two entities to within an ellipse.

member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the TwistAxis (or its entity-local version), the MaximumAngleX and MaximumAngleY, and the Basis. This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit.
member.param: First entity connected by the constraint.
Second entity connected by the constraint.

Axis in world space to use as the initial unrestricted twist direction. This direction will be transformed to entity A's local space to form the basis's primary axis and to entity B's local space to form its twist axis. The basis's x and y axis are automatically created from the twist axis.
Maximum angle of rotation around the basis X axis.
Maximum angle of rotation around the basis Y axis.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity)
member.summary: Constructs a new swing limit. Using this constructor will leave the limit uninitialized. Before using the limit in a simulation, be sure to set the basis axes using limit.basis.setLocalAxes or limit.basis.setWorldAxes and b's twist axis using the localTwistAxisB or twistAxisB properties.
member.param: First entity connected by the constraint.
Second entity connected by the constraint.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.Basis
member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis is the "twist" axis attached to entity A. The xAxis is the axis around which the angle will be limited by maximumAngleX. Similarly, the yAxis is the axis around which the angle will be limited by maximumAngleY.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.LocalTwistAxisB
member.summary: Gets or sets the twist axis attached to entity B in its local space. The transformed twist axis will be used to determine the angles around entity A's basis axes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angle of rotation around the x axis. This can be thought of as the major radius of the swing limit's ellipse.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.MaximumAngleY
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angle of rotation around the y axis. This can be thought of as the minor radius of the swing limit's ellipse.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.EllipseSwingLimit.TwistAxisB
member.summary: Gets or sets the twist axis attached to entity B in world space. The transformed twist axis will be used to determine the angles around entity A's basis axes.
