member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which prevents the connected entities from rotating relative to each other around an axis beyond given limits. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the TestAxis (or its entity-local version) and the Basis. This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUutilities.Vector3,BEPUutilities.Vector3,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which prevents the connected entities from rotating relative to each other around an axis beyond given limits.
member.param: First connection of the pair.
Second connection of the pair.
Axis of rotation to be limited.
Axis attached to connectionB that is tested to determine the current angle. Will also be used as the base rotation axis representing 0 degrees.
Minimum twist angle allowed.
Maximum twist angle allowed.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity)
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which prevents the connected entities from rotating relative to each other around an axis beyond given limits. Using this constructor will leave the limit uninitialized. Before using the limit in a simulation, be sure to set the basis axes using Basis.SetLocalAxes or Basis.SetWorldAxes and the test axis using the LocalTestAxis or TestAxis properties.
member.param: First connection of the pair.
Second connection of the pair.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.Basis
member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis represents the limited axis of rotation. The 'measurement plane' which the test axis is tested against is based on this primary axis. The x axis defines the 'base' direction on the measurement plane corresponding to 0 degrees of relative rotation.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.LocalTestAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis attached to entity B in its local space that will be tested against the limits.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.MaximumAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angle that entities can twist.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.MinimumAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum angle that entities can twist.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.TestAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis attached to entity B in world space that will be tested against the limits.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.RelativeVelocity
member.summary: Gets the current relative velocity between the connected entities with respect to the constraint. The revolute limit is special; internally, it is sometimes two constraints. The X value of the vector is the "minimum" plane of the limit, and the Y value is the "maximum" plane. If a plane isn't active, its error is zero.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.TotalImpulse
member.summary: Gets the total impulse applied by this constraint. The x component corresponds to the minimum plane limit, while the y component corresponds to the maximum plane limit.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.RevoluteLimit.Error
member.summary: Gets the current constraint error. The x component corresponds to the minimum plane limit, while the y component corresponds to the maximum plane limit.

member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis represents the twist axis attached to entity A. The x axis and y axis represent a plane against which entity B's attached x axis is projected to determine the twist angle.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.JointLimits.TwistLimit.BasisB
member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity B. The primary axis represents the twist axis attached to entity A. The x axis is projected onto the plane defined by localTransformA's x and y axes to get the twist angle.

member.summary: Constrains two entities to rotate only around a single axis. Acts like the angular portion of a hinge joint.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Joints.RevoluteAngularJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new orientation joint. Orientation joints can be used to simulate the angular portion of a hinge. Orientation joints allow rotation around only a single axis. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the WorldFreeAxisA and WorldFreeAxisB (or their entity-local versions). This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

Second entity connected in the orientation joint.
Axis allowed to rotate freely in world space.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Joints.SwivelHingeAngularJoint
member.summary: Constrains two bodies so that they can rotate relative to each other like a modified door hinge. Instead of removing two degrees of freedom, only one is removed so that the second connection to the constraint can twist.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Joints.SwivelHingeAngularJoint.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint which allows relative angular motion around a hinge axis and a twist axis. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the WorldHingeAxis and WorldTwistAxis (or their entity-local versions). This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.Motor
member.summary: Superclass of constraints which do work and change the velocity of connected entities, but have no specific position target.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.Motor.usedSoftness
member.summary: Softness divided by the timestep to maintain timestep independence.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.Motor.ComputeMaxForces(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the maxForceDt and maxForceDtSquared fields.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorMode
member.summary: Defines the behavior style of a motor.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorMode.VelocityMotor
member.summary:
Velocity motors only work to try to reach some relative velocity. They have no position goal.
When this type is selected, the motor settings' velocityMotor data will be used.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorMode.Servomechanism
member.summary:
Servomechanisms change their velocity in order to reach some position goal.
When this type is selected, the motor settings' servo data will be used.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorSettings
member.summary: Contains genereal settings for motors.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorSettings.MaximumForce
member.summary: Gets and sets the maximum impulse that the constraint will attempt to apply when satisfying its requirements. This field can be used to simulate friction in a constraint.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorSettings.Mode
member.summary:
Gets or sets what kind of motor this is.
If velocityMotor is chosen, the motor will try to achieve some velocity using the VelocityMotorSettings.
If servomechanism is chosen, the motor will try to reach some position using the ServoSettings.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.MotorSettings1D
member.summary: Contains settings for motors which act on one degree of freedom.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum extra velocity that the constraint will apply in an effort to correct any constraint error.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings.softness
member.summary: Softness of this constraint. Higher values of softness allow the constraint to be violated more. Must be greater than zero. Sometimes, if a joint system is unstable, increasing the softness of the involved constraints will make it settle down.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings.Softness
member.summary: Gets and sets the softness of this constraint. Higher values of softness allow the constraint to be violated more. Must be greater than zero. Sometimes, if a joint system is unstable, increasing the softness of the involved constraints will make it settle down. For motors, softness can be used to implement damping. For a damping constant k, the appropriate softness is 1/k.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.VelocityMotorSettings1D

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.RevoluteMotor
member.summary: Tries to rotate two entities so that they reach a specified relative orientation or speed around an axis.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.RevoluteMotor.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint tries to rotate two entities so that they reach a specified relative orientation around an axis. To finish the initialization, specify the connections (ConnectionA and ConnectionB) as well as the Basis and TestAxis. This constructor sets the constraint's IsActive property to false by default.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.RevoluteMotor.#ctor(BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity,BEPUutilities.Vector3)
member.summary: Constructs a new constraint tries to rotate two entities so that they reach a specified relative orientation around an axis.
member.param: First connection of the pair.
Second connection of the pair.
Rotation axis to control in world space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.RevoluteMotor.Basis
member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis represents the motorized axis of rotation. The 'measurement plane' which the test axis is tested against is based on this primary axis. The x axis defines the 'base' direction on the measurement plane corresponding to 0 degrees of relative rotation.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.RevoluteMotor.LocalTestAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis attached to entity B in its local space. This axis is projected onto the x and y axes of transformA to determine the hinge angle.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.RevoluteMotor.Settings
member.summary: Gets the motor's velocity and servo settings.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Constraints.TwoEntity.Motors.RevoluteMotor.TestAxis
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis attached to entity B in world space. This axis is projected onto the x and y axes of the Basis attached to entity A to determine the hinge angle.

member.summary: Gets the current relative velocity between the connected entities with respect to the constraint.

member.summary: Gets the total impulse applied by this constraint.

member.summary: Gets the current constraint error. If the motor is in velocity only mode, the error is zero.

member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity A. The primary axis represents the twist axis attached to entity A. The x axis and y axis represent a plane against which entity B's attached x axis is projected to determine the twist angle.

member.summary: Gets the basis attached to entity B. The primary axis represents the twist axis attached to entity B. The x axis is projected onto the plane defined by localTransformA's x and y axes to get the twist angle.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager
member.summary: Manages the sleeping states of objects.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.VelocityLowerLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity under which the deactivation system will consider objects to be deactivation candidates (if their velocity stays below the limit for the LowVelocityTimeMinimum). Defaults to 0.26.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.LowVelocityTimeMinimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the time limit above which the deactivation system will consider objects to be deactivation candidates (if their velocity stays below the VelocityLowerLimit for the duration). Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.UseStabilization
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to use a stabilization effect on nearly motionless objects. This removes a lot of energy from a system when things are settling down, allowing them to go to sleep faster. It also makes most simulations appear a lot more robust. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.DeactivationManagement.DeactivationManager.MaximumDeactivationAttemptsPerFrame

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.WorldTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets the world transform of the entity. The upper left 3x3 part is the Orientation, and the translation is the Position. When setting this property, ensure that the rotation matrix component does not include any scaling or shearing.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.AngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular velocity of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.AngularMomentum
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular momentum of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.LinearVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear velocity of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.LinearMomentum
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear momentum of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.MotionState
member.summary: Gets or sets the position, orientation, linear velocity, and angular velocity of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.IsDynamic
member.summary: Gets whether or not the entity is dynamic. Dynamic entities have finite mass and respond to collisions. Kinematic (non-dynamic) entities have infinite mass and inertia and will plow through anything.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.Gravity
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity's personal gravity. If null, the ForceUpdater's gravity is used instead. Defaults to null.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.BufferedStates
member.summary: Gets the buffered states of the entity. If the Space.BufferedStates manager is enabled, this property provides access to the buffered and interpolated states of the entity. Buffered states are the most recent completed update values, while interpolated states are the previous values blended with the current frame's values. Interpolated states are helpful when updating the engine with internal time stepping, giving entity motion a smooth appearance even when updates aren't occurring consistently every frame. Both are buffered for asynchronous access.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.InertiaTensorInverse
member.summary: Gets the world space inertia tensor inverse of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.InertiaTensor
member.summary: Gets the world space inertia tensor of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.LocalInertiaTensor
member.summary: Gets or sets the local inertia tensor of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.LocalInertiaTensorInverse
member.summary: Gets or sets the local inertia tensor inverse of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass of the entity. Setting this to an invalid value, such as a non-positive number, NaN, or infinity, makes the entity kinematic. Setting it to a valid positive number will also scale the inertia tensor if it was already dynamic, or force the calculation of a new inertia tensor if it was previously kinematic.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.InverseMass
member.summary: Gets or sets the inverse mass of the entity.

member.name: E:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.PositionUpdated
member.summary: Fires when the entity's position and orientation is updated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.CollisionInformation
member.summary: Gets the collidable used by the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.Locker
member.summary: Gets the synchronization object used by systems that need exclusive access to the entity's properties.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.Material
member.summary: Gets or sets the material used by the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.SolverUpdateables
member.summary: Gets all the EntitySolverUpdateables associated with this entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.Constraints
member.summary: Gets the two-entity constraints associated with this entity (a subset of the solver updateables).

member.summary: Applies an impulse to the entity.

member.summary: Applies an impulse to the entity without activating the entity.

Impulse to apply.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.ApplyLinearImpulse(BEPUutilities.Vector3@)
member.summary: Applies a linear velocity change to the entity using the given impulse. This method does not wake up the object or perform any other nonessential operation; it is meant to be used for performance-sensitive constraint solving. Consider equivalently adding to the LinearMomentum property for convenience instead.
member.param: Impulse to apply.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.ApplyAngularImpulse(BEPUutilities.Vector3@)
member.summary: Applies an angular velocity change to the entity using the given impulse. This method does not wake up the object or perform any other nonessential operation; it is meant to be used for performance-sensitive constraint solving. Consider equivalently adding to the AngularMomentum property for convenience instead.
member.param: Impulse to apply.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.IgnoreShapeChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to ignore shape changes. When true, changing the entity's collision shape will not update the volume, density, or inertia tensor.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.BecomeKinematic
member.summary: Forces the entity to become kinematic. Kinematic entities have infinite mass and inertia.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.BecomeDynamic(System.Double)
member.summary: Forces the entity to become dynamic. Dynamic entities respond to collisions and have finite mass and inertia.
member.param: Mass to use for the entity.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.BecomeDynamic(System.Double,BEPUutilities.Matrix3x3)
member.summary: Forces the entity to become dynamic. Dynamic entities respond to collisions and have finite mass and inertia.
member.param: Mass to use for the entity.
Inertia tensor to use for the entity.

member.summary: Gets the space that owns the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.PositionUpdateMode
member.summary: Gets the position update mode of the entity.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.AngularDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular damping of the entity. Values range from 0 to 1, corresponding to a fraction of angular momentum removed from the entity over a unit of time.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.LinearDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear damping of the entity. Values range from 0 to 1, corresponding to a fraction of linear momentum removed from the entity over a unit of time.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.ModifyLinearDamping(System.Double)
member.summary: Temporarily adjusts the linear damping by an amount. After the value is used, the damping returns to the base value.
member.param: Damping to add.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.ModifyAngularDamping(System.Double)
member.summary: Temporarily adjusts the angular damping by an amount. After the value is used, the damping returns to the base value.
member.param: Damping to add.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Entities.Entity.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the user data associated with the entity. This is separate from the entity's collidable's tag. If a tag needs to be accessed from within the collision detection pipeline, consider using the entity.CollisionInformation.Tag.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.EntityStateManagement.InterpolatedStatesManager.BlendAmount
member.summary: Gets or sets the blending amount to use. This is set automatically when the space is using internal timestepping (I.E. when Space.Update(dt) is called). It is a value from 0 to 1 that defines the amount of the previous and current frames to include in the blended state. A value of 1 means use only the current frame; a value of 0 means use only the previous frame.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.EntityStateManagement.InterpolatedStatesManager.FlipBuffers
member.summary: Acquires a lock on the FlipLocker and flips the internal buffers.

member.returns: Interpolated state associated with the entity at the given index.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume
member.summary: Volume in which physically simulated objects have a buoyancy force applied to them based on their density and volume.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.UpVector
member.summary: Gets or sets the up vector of the fluid volume.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.DensityMultipliers
member.summary: Gets or sets the dictionary storing density multipliers for the fluid volume. If a value is specified for an entity, the density of the object is effectively scaled to match. Higher values make entities sink more, lower values make entities double more.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.BoundingBox
member.summary: Bounding box surrounding the surface triangles and entire depth of the object.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.MaxDepth
member.summary: Maximum depth of the fluid from the surface.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.Density
member.summary: Density of the fluid represented in the volume.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.SamplePointsPerDimension
member.summary: Number of locations along each of the horizontal axes from which to sample the shape. Defaults to 8.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.LinearDamping
member.summary: Fraction by which to reduce the linear momentum of doubleing objects each update.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.AngularDamping
member.summary: Fraction by which to reduce the angular momentum of doubleing objects each update.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.FlowDirection
member.summary: Direction in which to exert force on objects within the fluid. flowForce and maxFlowSpeed must have valid values as well for the flow to work.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.FlowForce
member.summary: Magnitude of the flow's force, in units of flow direction. flowDirection and maxFlowSpeed must have valid values as well for the flow to work.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.MaxFlowSpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed of the flow; objects will not be accelerated by the flow force beyond this speed. flowForce and flowDirection must have valid values as well for the flow to work.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.ParallelLooper
member.summary: Gets or sets the parallel loop provider used by the fluid volume.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.UpdateableSystems.FluidVolume.SurfaceTriangles
member.summary: List of coplanar triangles composing the surface of the fluid.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.CylinderCastWheelShape
member.summary: Uses a cylinder cast as the shape of a wheel.

member.summary: Gets or sets the unsteered orientation of the wheel in the vehicle's local space.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.CylinderCastWheelShape.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,BEPUutilities.Quaternion,BEPUutilities.Matrix,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new cylinder cast based wheel shape.
member.param: Radius of the wheel.
Width of the wheel.
Unsteered orientation of the wheel in the vehicle's local space.
Local graphic transform of the wheel shape. This transform is applied first when creating the shape's worldTransform.

Whether or not to include the steering transform in the wheel shape cast. If false, the casted wheel shape will always point straight forward. If true, it will rotate with steering. Sometimes, setting this to false is helpful when the cast shape would otherwise become exposed when steering.

member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the wheel.

member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the wheel.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.CylinderCastWheelShape.IncludeSteeringTransformInCast
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to include the rotation from steering in the cast. If false, the casted wheel shape will always point straight forward. If true, it will rotate with steering. Sometimes, setting this to false is helpful when the cast shape would otherwise become exposed when steering.

member.summary: Updates the wheel's world transform for graphics. Called automatically by the owning wheel at the end of each frame. If the engine is updating asynchronously, you can call this inside of a space read buffer lock and update the wheel transforms safely.

member.summary: Gets or sets the coefficient of braking dynamic friction for this wheel. This coefficient and the supporting entity's coefficient of friction will be taken into account to determine the used coefficient at any given time. This coefficient is used instead of the rollingFrictionCoefficient when isBraking is true.

member.summary: Gets the axis along which rolling friction is applied.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.WheelBrake.IsBraking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not the wheel is braking. When set to true, the brakingFrictionCoefficient is used. When false, the rollingFrictionCoefficient is used.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.WheelBrake.RollingFrictionCoefficient
member.summary: Gets or sets the coefficient of rolling friction for this wheel. This coefficient is used instead of the brakingFrictionCoefficient when isBraking is false.

This coefficient is used instead of the rollingFrictionCoefficient when isBraking is true.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.WheelShape.AirborneWheelDeceleration

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.WheelShape.SpinAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the current spin angle of this wheel. This changes each frame based on the relative velocity between the support and the wheel.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Vehicle.WheelShape.SpinVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the graphical spin velocity of the wheel based on the relative velocity between the support and the wheel. Whenever the wheel is in contact with the ground, the spin velocity will be each frame.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Paths.SpeedControlledCurve`1
member.summary: Wrapper that controls the speed at which a curve is traversed.

remarks.para: Even if a curve is evaluated at linearly increasing positions, the distance between consecutive values can be different. This has the effect of a curve-following object having variable velocity.
To counteract the variable velocity, this wrapper samples the curve and produces a reparameterized, distance-based curve. Changing the evaluated curve position will linearly change the value.

member.summary: Constructs a new speed controlled curve.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings
member.summary: Settings class containing global information about collision detection.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.ContactInvalidationLength
member.summary:
For persistent manifolds, contacts are represented by an offset in local space of two colliding bodies. The distance between these offsets transformed into world space and projected onto a plane defined by the contact normal squared is compared against this value. If this value is exceeded, the contact is removed from the contact manifold.
If the world is smaller or larger than 'normal' for the engine, adjusting this value proportionally can improve contact caching behavior. The default value of .1f works well for worlds that operate on the order of 1 unit.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.ContactMinimumSeparationDistance
member.summary: In persistent manifolds, if two contacts are too close together, then the system will not use one of them. This avoids redundant constraints. Defaults to .03f.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.NonconvexNormalAngleDifferenceMinimum
member.summary: In regular convex manifolds, two contacts are considered redundant if their positions are too close together. In nonconvex manifolds, the normal must also be tested, since a contact in the same location could have a different normal. This property is the minimum angle in radians between normals below which contacts are considered redundant.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.AllowedPenetration
member.summary: The default amount of allowed penetration into the margin before position correcting impulses will be applied. Defaults to .01f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.DefaultMargin
member.summary: Default collision margin around objects. Margins help prevent objects from interpenetrating and improve stability. Defaults to .04f.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionDetectionSettings.MaximumContactDistance
member.summary: Maximum distance between the surfaces defining a contact point allowed before removing the contact. Defaults to .1f.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings
member.summary: Contains global settings relating to the collision response system.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.BouncinessVelocityThreshold
member.summary: Impact velocity above which the full bounciness of a material pair is taken into account. Below the threshold, the extra energy introduced by the bounce is reduced. The lower the velocity is relative to the threshold, the lower the effective bounciness. Defaults to 1.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.MaximumPenetrationRecoverySpeed
member.summary: Maximum speed at which interpenetrating objects will attempt to undo any overlap. Defaults to 2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.PenetrationRecoveryStiffness
member.summary: Fraction of position error to convert into corrective momentum. Defaults to 0.2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.StaticFrictionVelocityThreshold
member.summary: Magnitude of relative velocity at a contact point below which staticFriction is used. dynamicFriction is used when velocity exceeds this threshold. Defaults to 0.2.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.CollisionResponseSettings.TwistFrictionFactor
member.summary: Value by which a collision pair's friction coefficient will be multiplied to get the twist friction coefficient. Defaults to 1.

summary.para: Softness multiplier used by collision penetration constraints. Higher softness values allow more velocity error and make things look 'squishier'. Defaults to 0.001.
Note that this value is not used directly by constraints; it is first scaled by the raw inverse effective mass. This allows consistent behavior across objects with different masses.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings
member.summary: Contains global settings about motion updating.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.CoreShapeScaling
member.summary: The scaling to apply to the core shapes used for continuous collision detection tests. Values should be between 0 and 0.99f. The smaller the value, the smaller the shapes used to perform CCD are, and more collisions are missed. Defaults to .8f.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.DefaultPositionUpdateMode
member.summary: The default position updating mode used by position updateables. Defaults to Discrete.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.UseExtraExpansionForContinuousBoundingBoxes
member.summary: It is possible for an object in danger of being hit by a moving object to have a bounding box which does not contain the resulting motion, and CCD will fail to detect a secondary collision. Setting this to true will take into account nearby objects' velocities and use them to enlarge the bounding box so that secondary collisions are not missed. The larger size of bounding boxes can cause an increase in collision pairs during stressful situations, which can harm performance. Defaults to false.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.Settings.MotionSettings.CCDFilter
member.summary: Delegate which determines if a given pair should be allowed to run continuous collision detection. This is only called for entities which are continuous and colliding with other objects. By default, this prevents CCD from being used in any pair where the pair's CollisionRule stops collision response.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Settings.CCDFilter
member.summary: Delegate which determines if a given pair should be allowed to run continuous collision detection. This is only called for entities which are continuous and colliding with other objects.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.Space
member.summary: Main simulation class of BEPUphysics. Contains various updating stages addition/removal methods for getting objects into the simulation.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.TimeStepSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the time step settings used by the space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.ParallelLooper
member.summary: Gets or sets the parallel loop provider used by the space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.SpaceObjectBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the space object buffer used by the space. The space object buffer allows objects to be safely asynchronously added to and removed from the space.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.EntityStateWriteBuffer
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity state write buffer used by the space. The write buffer contains buffered writes to entity states that are flushed each frame when the buffer is updated.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.DeactivationManager
member.summary: Gets or sets the deactivation manager used by the space. The deactivation manager controls the activity state objects, putting them to sleep and managing the connections between objects and simulation islands.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.ForceUpdater
member.summary: Gets or sets the force updater used by the space. The force updater applies forces to all dynamic objects in the space each frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BoundingBoxUpdater
member.summary: Gets or sets the bounding box updater used by the space. The bounding box updater updates the bounding box of mobile collidables each frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BroadPhase
member.summary: Gets or sets the broad phase used by the space. The broad phase finds overlaps between broad phase entries and passes them off to the narrow phase for processing.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.NarrowPhase
member.summary: Gets or sets the narrow phase used by the space. The narrow phase uses overlaps found by the broad phase to create pair handlers. Those pair handlers can go on to create things like contacts and constraints.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.Solver
member.summary: Gets or sets the solver used by the space. The solver iteratively finds a solution to the constraints in the simulation.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.PositionUpdater
member.summary: Gets or sets the position updater used by the space. The position updater moves everything around each frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BufferedStates
member.summary: Gets or sets the buffered states manager used by the space. The buffered states manager keeps track of read buffered entity states and also interpolated states based on the time remaining from internal time steps.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.DeferredEventDispatcher
member.summary: Gets or sets the deferred event dispatcher used by the space. The event dispatcher gathers up deferred events created over the course of a timestep and dispatches them sequentially at the end.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.DuringForcesUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update during force application.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BeforeNarrowPhaseUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update before the narrow phase.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BeforeSolverUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update before the solver

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.BeforePositionUpdateUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update right before the position update phase.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.EndOfTimeStepUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update at the end of a timestep.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.EndOfFrameUpdateables
member.summary: Gets or sets the updateable manager that handles updateables that update at the end of a frame.

member.name: P:BEPUphysics.Space.Entities
member.summary: Gets the list of entities in the space.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new space for things to live in. This overload does not provide an IParallelLooper, so it makes the space single threaded. Use the other overload or set the Space.ParallelLooper property to use multiple threads.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.#ctor(BEPUutilities.Threading.IParallelLooper)
member.summary: Constructs a new space for things to live in.
member.param: Used by the space to perform multithreaded updates. Pass null if multithreading is not required.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.Add(BEPUphysics.ISpaceObject)
member.summary: Adds a space object to the simulation.
member.param: Space object to add.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.Remove(BEPUphysics.ISpaceObject)
member.summary: Removes a space object from the simulation.
member.param: Space object to remove.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.Update
member.summary: Performs a single timestep.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.Update(System.Double)
member.summary: Performs as many timesteps as necessary to get as close to the elapsed time as possible.
member.param: Elapsed time from the previous frame.

member.summary: Tests a ray against the space.

Hit data of the ray, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the ray hit anything.

member.name: M:BEPUphysics.Space.ConvexCast(BEPUphysics.CollisionShapes.ConvexShapes.ConvexShape,BEPUutilities.RigidTransform@,BEPUutilities.Vector3@,BEPUphysics.RayCastResult@)

summary.para: Casts a convex shape against the space.
Convex casts are sensitive to length; avoid extremely long convex casts for better stability and performance.

member.param: Shape to cast.
Initial transform of the shape.
Sweep to apply to the shape. Avoid extremely long convex casts for better stability and performance.
Hit data, if any.
member.returns: Whether or not the cast hit anything.

member.name: T:BEPUphysics.TimeStepSettings
member.summary: Contains settings for the instance's time step.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.TimeStepSettings.MaximumTimeStepsPerFrame
member.summary: Maximum number of timesteps to perform during a given frame when Space.Update(double) is used. The unsimulated time will be accumulated for subsequent calls to Space.Update(double). Defaults to 3.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.TimeStepSettings.TimeStepDuration
member.summary: Length of each integration step. Calling a Space's Update() method moves time forward this much. The other method, Space.Update(double), will try to move time forward by the amount specified in the parameter by taking steps of TimeStepDuration size. Defaults to 1/60.

member.name: F:BEPUphysics.TimeStepSettings.AccumulatedTime
member.summary: Amount of time accumulated by previous calls to Space.Update(double) that has not yet been simulated.
